Eighth year of the victorious king Kampavikramavarman.
Handwritten writ document for the sale of a land i.e. sale-deed by We, the members of the assembly of Uttaramērucaturvedimaṅgala in Kāliyūrkkōṭṭam, in the division of the same name.
We, the members of the assembly, have given for sale viṟṟu-k koṭuttōm that which is two quarters iru-k-kāl-āvatum of these.
We, the members of the assembly, have given for sale viṟṟu-k koṭuttōm that which is three quarters mu-k-kāl-āvatum of these.
We, the members of the assembly, have solemnly given this itu-v-ē as a … (poru[ḷā>ḷ] māvaṟiti) written leaf ōlai-y-āka.

We, the members of the assembly, will/have the title-deed given paṭṭasāmantuk koṭuvitttōm āṉōm, literally “we have become those who had title-deed given”, whereas pōla the above-mentioned Kuravaciri Rāmadeva-bhaṭṭa and his younger brothers, the three of them mūvaraiyum surrounded/rounded/went round the land, after going round the land got as bahirbhūmi bahirbhūmi-y-āka koṇṭa nilam cuṭṭi to that tank avvērikkē which surrounds … ik-kaṟikai-kuṭṭattu ēri-karai-y-il maṇ koṇṭāraiyum ik-kaṟikai-k-kuṭṭatiṉ cuṟṟum.

Let the members of the MP mūlappa[ṭ/ṭṭ]ārayarē be those who fine those who dig muḷ((k))kuttiṉāraiy‡um; IP: the person who dug in these banks with five kaḻañcu of gold as capital veṭṭi mutal-āka for the Vajramegha tank vaiyiramēkataṭākattukkē. Thus have We, the members of the assembly, solemnly given declared in this instance; i.e. paṇittōm = kuṭuttōm by mistake
Let those who draw/let out water nīrviṭṭār in/from this Karikai-kuṭṭam be considered traitors to the village grāmakaṇṭakar. Thus have We, the members of the assembly, declared/ordered.
First edited in (SII 6, no. 288). Edited and summarised in (IP no. 205). This edition by Emmanuel Francis (2020), based on autopsy and photographs (2019). First English translation.
